overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [14] This bill repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [14] All unencumbered funds in the repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the credit of the newly established University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [13]
appropriations: The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [14] An earlier version of the bill intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [14] The final version of the bill does not contain an appropriation. [14]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [13]
agency_impact: This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii system. [13] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [13] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [13]
economic_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [13]
policy_impact: This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [13] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [13] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [13]
revenue_sources: There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [13] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [13] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. [13]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [13]
operating_revenue_impact: The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [13] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [13] The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. [13]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [13]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [13]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: This fiscal note is based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. [14] The previous version of the bill included a provision to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [14] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [14] The Committee also made technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [14]
fte_positions: The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [13]
appropriations_changes: A previous version of the measure was intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [14] The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [14] Therefore, the C.D. 1 version of the bill contains no appropriation. [14]
funding_sources_changes: As the appropriation has been removed, there are no changes to funding sources because there is no appropriation to be funded. [14]
department_impact: The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the University of Hawaii remains the relevant entity for the revolving fund. [13]
reports_required: The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [13] This report must account for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [13]
pilot_program: The provided documents do not establish a pilot program. [13]
sunset_date: The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [13]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [13] The previous version of the bill had a separate effective date for an appropriation section, which has now been removed. [14]
